title: Fragment, ca. 1740
medium:
Medium: silk, metallic thread
Technique: plain weave with a set of supplementary warps (orange) and discontinuous supplementary wefts (silks and metallics) bound on the front in 1/3 twill
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 97 x 11.5 cm (38 3/16 x 4 1/2 in.)
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Long narrow fragment from the right side of a pattern which had a ship at sea and bold vegetation in bright colors and metallic thread.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fragment, ca. 1740.
ca. 1740. Medium: silk, metallic thread
Technique: plain weave with a set of supplementary warps (orange) and discontinuous supplementary wefts (silks and metallics) bound on the front in 1/3 twill. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-58-30.
